page.title: 06TOURISM IN STOCKSBRIDGE
page.content: MANY PEOPLE VISIT THE NEARBY VILLAGE OF BOLSTERSTONE TO SEE THE OLD BUILDINGS AND THE COUNTRYSIDE NEARBY. ONE OLD BUILDING IS CALLED THE PORTER'S LODGE, WHICH IS SAID TO BE PART OF THE REMAINS OF A CASTLE BUILT IN THE 13TH CENTURY. PEOPLE SAY THAT THE WALLS OF THE FIELDS LEADING TO THE ROCKS WERE THOUGHT TO BE PART OF THE CASTLE REMAINS. TO THE NORTHEAST IS WALDERS LOW, WHICH IS SAID TO BE THE BURIAL SITE OF A SAXON CHIEF CALLED WALDER. EWDEN VALLEY TO THE SOUTH OF THE VILLAGE IS THOUGHT TO BE CALLED AFTER THE EWE TREES THAT GROW THERE, OR POSSIBLY THE "DEN" OR VALLEY OF A SAXON CHIEF CALLED YEW. IN STOCKSBRIDGE AND BOLSTERSTONE THERE ARE PUBLIC FOOTPATHS FOR EXPLORING THE COUNTRYSIDE.
